title: Why is Nirvana's song called “Lithium”? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Lithium” is an element, used as effective drug in therapeutic schemes for bipolar disorder (manic / depression disorder), as a mood-stabilizer, in Psychiatry (Lithium - Wikipedia). I have the sense that it is used as a metaphor for the narrative of “Lithium”, which is about a person who “finds God”; religion here can be translated as this individual’s personal “mood-stabilizer” (like, lithium). Lithium (Nirvana song) - Wikipedia Not a bad concept, artistically - and a terrific song, in the end!

As previously mentioned lithium is a drug to treat bipolar. The nature of bipolar is mood swings; you can go from feeling great to feeling terrible in moments and kurt Cobain suffered from bipolar as did some of his family. If you listen to the lyrics many of them switch from being very positive to very negative and vice versa. I believe the song was meant to capture the nature pf bipolar and the song title furthered that
